comments: We're studying the license matters with the BSC lawyer

states.command: python corpus-cleaner/clean.py cat-warc --input-path corpora/crawling_ca_20200525 --input-format warc --output-format fairseq-lm --lang-filter ca --parallel; bash corpus-cleaner/postprocess.sh

states.action_comments: The corpus-cleaner execution was correct but introduced spaces among apostrophes so we fixed it with postprocess3.sh

comments: Collection of documents from the official journal of the Catalan Goverment in Catalan and Spanish
Each paragrah could be considered as a document as it is not sentence splitted. Added empty lines to mark document boundaries.

The crawling was made on the following domains and years: .ad (2015,2017), .com (2018), news crawling (2011,2015,2016,2017) and other domains (2004). All the documents have been merged into a single one and exact duplicated entries were removed.
Collection of translated movie subtitles from http://www.opensubtitles.org/

OSCAR is a multilingual corpus obtained by language classification and filtering of the Common Crawl. Each paragrah could be considered as a document as it is not sentence splitted. Added empty lines to mark document boundaries.

OSCAR is a multilingual corpus obtained by language classification and filtering of the Common Crawl. Each paragrah could be considered as a document as it is not sentence splitted. Added empty lines to mark document boundaries.
The corpus can be published according to its license.
No clear license provided - publically available on the web. The corpus has already been published

provider: NLP group from University of Zagreb
comments: The corpus has already been published.

states.command:
python corpus-cleaner/clean.py cawac-dist --input-path data/cawac --input-format document --output-format fairseq-lm --lang-filter ca --lang-chars-filter 0.15 --dictionary-filter-sen example-dict.txt --encoding utf-8 --parallel --backend ray;
bash scripts/postprocess3.sh
states.action_comments: The corpus-cleaner execution was correct but introduced spaces among apostrophes so we fixed it with postprocess3.sh

comments: Four parallel files for two language pairs (es-ca and es-eu) and then three individual files for es, ca, and eu. The corpus has been automatically aligned, alignment average error rate is 2% (es-ca) and 15% (eu-es). Monolingual files have been normalized (@user and URLs are standarized to 'IDIDID' dnd 'URLURLURL', respectively). The corpus has already been published.

Empty lines are used to mark document boundaries. The crawling is active and it it is planned to publish it. The licensing will be decided then. I am unsure whether the corpus can be published or not.

corpus_name: Catalan - English United Nations Test Set
comments: This corpus comprises the English testset and the catalan testset. Each document has 4000 sentences.

versions.version_name: Catalan - English United Nations test set v1.0

comments: Downloadable from task webpage contained IDs, language tags and some documents tagged as English. DT file contains documents separated by new line characters being the first sentence the title

corpus_name: Parallel corpus from the European Medicines Agency
provider: OPUS - the open collection of parallel corpora
comments:
Release date: Sat Mar  3 21:51:43 EET 2018
This is a parallel corpus made out of PDF documents from the European Medicines Agency. All files are automatically converted from PDF to plain text using pdftotext with the command line arguments -layout -nopgbrk -eol unix. There are some known problems with tables and multi-column layouts - some of them are fixed in the current version.

versions.version_name: EMEA parallel corpora es-en released on 2018-03-03

source: Used this script https://svn.code.sf.net/p/apertium/svn/trunk/apertium-tools/WikiExtractor.py to download this file cawiki-20200801-pages-articles.xml.bz2 from here https://ftp.acc.umu.se/mirror/wikimedia.org/dumps/cawiki/20200801/
comments: Documents are splitted by new lines but it is not sentence splitted. I have manually deleted the colon from files after the titles using sed 's/:$//'

bash scripts/postprocess3.sh

provider: agencia española de medicamentos y productos sanitarios

states.script_location: Felipe did it, I am not sure we have the script or not.

corpus_name: Google Patent in Medical Domain for Spain (Spanish)
comments:
Accepted codes (Medical Domain) for Json files of patents: "A61B", "A61C","A61F", "A61H", "A61K", "A61L","A61M", "A61B", "A61P"
We extracted "title_localized" and "abstract_localized" if "country_cod" was "Spain" and language was "es" (Spanish).

corpus_name: The Scientific Electronic Library Online – SciELO Spain (http://scielo.isciii.es)
comments: Crawler is in https://github.com/PlanTL-SANIDAD/SciELO-Spain-Crawler

corpus_name: wikipedia dump in Spanish from biology, pharmacy, pharmacology and medicine  es  biomedical
comments: Unknown date but it is crawling on November 2018

corpus_name: clinical case conference proceedings published by medical societies
source: Clinical case conference proceedings published by medical societies
comments:
Martin's comment:
We do not have the original URLs, as this data set was download manually in a more exploratory setting (to check out if its useful/worthwhile to process).
Most of the files correspond to clinical case conference proceedings published by medical societies. They correspond to special articles describing a patient o collection of patients often written by MDs in their first years of speciality.

versions.version_name: clinical case conference proceedings published by medical societies for 2014 to 2016

source: cawac_ca/v1/s2, crawling_ca/v1/s3, dogc_ca-es/v1/s1/ca.txt, open_subtitles_ca/v1/s1, oscar_ca/v1/s1, wikipedia_ca/v1/s2
comments: A new line has been added to the end of each file before concatenation to respect document boundaries. DOGC and OpenSub are not document parseable. Open license, but not sure which.
